meanings.definition: To divide into two equal parts
meanings.sent1: I will bisect the cake so we each get an equal piece.
meanings.sent2: The ruler helped me bisect the line perfectly in the middle.
meanings.sent3: I tried to bisect the sandwich, but the peanut butter kept sticking to one side!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to bisect the room, lighting up every corner.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to bisect the air, creating a sense of wonder.

meanings.definition: To intersect or cross at a midpoint
meanings.sent1: The hiking trails bisect at the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The roads bisect in the center of the town, making it easy to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to bisect my path every time I tried to walk through the room!
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to bisect the forest, creating a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The lightning bolt appeared to bisect the sky, splitting it in two.
